meanings.definition: To strike or beat with a heavy club or weapon.
meanings.sent1: The caveman becudgeled the rock to make tools.
meanings.sent2: The knight becudgeled the dragon with his sword.
meanings.sent3: The chef becudgeled the dough to make it soft and fluffy.
meanings.sent4: The storm becudgeled the trees, bending them to its will.
meanings.sent5: The blacksmith becudgeled the metal into shape with his hammer.

meanings.definition: To severely criticize or reprimand someone.
meanings.sent1: The teacher becudgeled the student for not completing the homework.
meanings.sent2: The boss becudgeled the employee for being late to work.
meanings.sent3: The coach becudgeled the team for their lack of effort during the game.
meanings.sent4: The judge becudgeled the lawyer for his unpreparedness in court.
meanings.sent5: The parent becudgeled the child for breaking the vase.
